identificationModule.briefTitle: Dysfunction of Olfaction After COVID-19 Infection: Morphological and Histomolecular Investigation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Dysfunction of Olfaction After SARS-CoV-2 Infection: Morphological and Histomolecular Investigation of Olfactory Cleft Biopsies and Cytobrushes

collaborators.name: Max Planck Research Unit for Neurogenetics

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Investigation of the mechanisms of persistent SARS-CoV-2 associated olfactory dysfunction (OD) in patients with well-documented olfactory function. The investigators plan to collect olfactory cleft biopsies and cytobrushes in COVID-19 patients and controls.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: An explorative prospective clinical study using human body materials of living post-COVID-19 patients with and without OD, to study the mechanisms of persisting olfactory dysfunction. Patients consult ENT specialist for medical purposes and undergo standard-of-care diagnostics and management. The collected tissues from the olfactory cleft mucosa will be analyzed using single cell RNA sequencing and RNAscope combined with immunohistochemistry.

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Biopsy and cytobrush during a scheduled structural intervention in general anesthesia

armGroups.label: Olfactory Dysfunction
armGroups.description: Biopsy and cytobrush during consultation in local anesthesia

interventions.name: Biopsy and Cytobrush
interventions.description: Collection of olfactory cleft biopsies and cytobrushes

primaryOutcomes.description:
Morphological and histomolecular differences between OD and control patients

* Evaluating tissue pathology:

  * Metaplasia
  * hypertrophy
  * aberrant scar formation
  * apoptosis
  * presence of inflammatory cells \[H\&E, CD68 and CD3 stainings, RNAscope\]
* Presence of SARS-CoV-2 RNA
* Percentage of OSNs versus sustentacular cells; maturation of OSNs
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From enrollment of 1 patient until analyzed, 1 month

primaryOutcomes.description:
Morphological and histomolecular differences between OD and control patients

* Evaluating tissue pathology:

  * Metaplasia
  * hypertrophy
  * aberrant scar formation
  * apoptosis
  * presence of inflammatory cells \[H\&E, CD68 and CD3 stainings, RNAscope\]
* Presence of SARS-CoV-2 RNA
* In the olfactory epithelium: percentage of OSNs versus sustentacular cells; maturation of OSNs
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From enrollment of 1 patient until analyzed, 1 month

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Olfactory Dysfunction group: Presence of evident OD (Parosmia, Threshold-Discrimination-Identification (TDI)-score ≤24, Subjective abnormal quantitative olfactory function; measured by a visual analogue score (VAS) of smell impairment ≥5/10
* Control group: No OD (TDI-score \>30.5.)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Presence of concomitant nasal mucosal pathology that might affect olfactory function or bias the study investigations
* Use of anticoagulation therapy
* Allergy to local anesthetics

locations.facility: Max Planck Research Unit for Neurogenetics
University of Zurich and University Hospital Zurich
